result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly A Hook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court waives standard Court costs. Cash bail applied to DNA Surcharge. PAID IN FULL.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

11:19 AM Defendant Kimberly A Hook in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea and sentencing.
State places offer on the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy.

In 21CM2023:   
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Counts 2 & 3 are Dismissed and read in.

In 22CF385: 
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Counts 1, 2 & 4 are Dismissed and read in.

Cases 21FO707 and 22FO126 are Dismissed and read in.

State and Defense make sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statement to the court.

In 21CM2023:
The Defendant was sentenced to the following:
JAIL:  9 MONTHS, Straight-time.
0  Days Credit.
Consecutive to any other sentence currently being served. 

Costs:  Court finds the Defendant indigent and waives court costs; 
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

**Cash on hand may be applied to surcharges in cases 21CM2023 and 22CM385 with the balance refunded to the poster. 
***********************

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

**Cash on hand in 21CM2023 may be applied to surcharges in cases 21CM2023 and 22CM385 with the balance refunded to the poster.

Hearing on March 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:17 AM Defendant Kimberly A Hook in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Brandon Kricher, of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by DDA Szczupakiewicz.
Cross examination by attorney Menden.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
